# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

Here is a Julia code snippet that satisfies the problem statement:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    result = ""
    current_line_length = 0

    for word in words
        if current_line_length + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            current_line_length = 0
        else
            result *= " "
            current_line_length += length(word)
        end
        
        result *= word
    end
    
    return result
end

println(wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines"))
```
